p: TAPSim [ 31] was then used to simulate the field evaporation process. As detailed in [ 32– 34], this requires the definition of a cascading mesh of integration points. At its finest scale, the mesh resolves the nanoscale dimensions and atomic structure of the specimen. At progressively coarser scales, it bridges to the centimeter-sized chamber of the atom probe. Fig 3 displays only the three finest scales of this composite mesh: the specimen itself, a finer mesh corresponding to a transition zone with a thickness of 2 nm to accurately capture the ion’s launch trajectories, and an order of magnitude more coarsely sampled support mesh.
